system.description:
A common accompaniment to any inventor, engineer, or enterprising natural philosopher, a set of tinkering tools provide a basis for performing detailed work. The tools will all be of fine and delicate quality, for maximum precision. Most toolkits include a loupe—a magnifying eyepiece for seeing small details more closely–and slim sets of screwdrivers, tweezers, and pliers for manipulating small objects carefully.

Better toolkits may cost far more, or require custom parts which must be hand-made or commissioned separately.
